solution_line_template: The two bags of cat food weigh {num_cat_bags} x {weight_per_cat_bag} = <<{num_cat_bags}*{weight_per_cat_bag}={total_cat_food_pounds}>>{total_cat_food_pounds} pounds.
Each bag of dog food weighs {weight_per_cat_bag} + {dog_food_extra_pounds} = <<{weight_per_cat_bag}+{dog_food_extra_pounds}={weight_per_dog_bag}>>{weight_per_dog_bag} pounds.
So two bags of dog food weigh {num_dog_bags} x {weight_per_dog_bag} = <<{num_dog_bags}*{weight_per_dog_bag}={total_dog_food_pounds}>>{total_dog_food_pounds} pounds.
Thus, Mrs. Anderson bought {total_cat_food_pounds} + {total_dog_food_pounds} = <<{total_cat_food_pounds}+{total_dog_food_pounds}={total_pet_food_pounds}>>{total_pet_food_pounds} pounds of pet food.
And {total_pet_food_pounds} pounds is equal to {total_pet_food_pounds} x {ounces_per_pound} = <<{total_pet_food_pounds}*{ounces_per_pound}={total_pet_food_ounces}>>{total_pet_food_ounces} ounces.
